answers.answer: He has to check with his doctor.  Sometimes you can control diabetes without medicines.  I am on metformin even though I can control my blood sugar with diet because metformin helps with weight loss, and I need to lose a lot of weight.  If it wasn't for the weight issue, my doctor would probably not have me on any medications since I am strict on my carb intake and diet.  I absolutely have no sweets and switched to sprouted grain bread (no flour and has a low GI) and high fiber carbs which are better for your blood sugars.  I gave up sweets, junk food, crackers/cookies/chips, ice cream for the most part with an occasional indulgance of 1/2 cup serving, and gave up rice and have only whole grain pasta.  So, if he's serious like that, maybe he can avoid the medication entirely.  But, you have to run everything by the doctors.  Only they can figure out with you what to do.

NEVER stop meds of any kind without consulting your doctor first.  Diabetes can bite you in the butt at the most inopportune time so be careful.  If he's tired of the meds and he's working hard to control with diet and exercise he may be a candidate for stopping but like I said, NEVER quit meds without a doctor telling you to.    Shane
